name: riot
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
C1 [ C ] an occasion when a large number of people behave in a noisy, violent, and uncontrolled way in public, often as a protest: Food protests and riots have erupted in more than 30 countries.
[ S ] old-fashioned informal a very funny or entertaining occasion or person: "How was the party?" "It was great - we had a riot." I met Mike's brother for the first time - he's a riot.
More examplesFewer examplesIn the riot, the statues were toppled from their pedestals.Police used tear gas to put the riot down.The weeks following the riots were extremely tense.The prison riots have sharpened the debate about how prisons should be run.According to unconfirmed reports, two people were killed in the riots last night.
